material.mattext: A company that provides coaching for the SAT claims in one of their adds: "90% of our students improve their SAT scores after attending our course". To check the company's claim, 500 students who took the company's course were sampled and it was found that 407 of them (81.4%) actually improved their SAT score after attending the course. Based on the sample results, we have some serious doubts regarding the accuracy of the company's claim.

Incorrect. Note that the conclusion above is not one where you estimate an unknown parameter, but rather a statement that the data obtained from the sample provide evidence against some claim that was made about the population.

Incorrect. Note that the conclusion above is not one where you estimate an unknown parameter, but rather a statement that the data obtained from the sample provide evidence against some claim that was made about the population.
Good Job! Indeed, in this case, we some claim, and we are using the data to assess it's accuracy.
